Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ninny \Nin"ny\, n.; pl. {Ninnies}. [Cf. It. ninno, ninna, a baby, Sp. ni[~n]o, ni[~n]a, child, infant, It. ninna, ninna nanna, lullably, prob. fr. ni, na, as used in singing a child to sleep.] A fool; a simpleton. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
ninny n : a stupid foolish person [syn: {nincompoop}, {poop}]
